alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...CENTRAL COCKE AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 504 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Baneberry, or near Dandridge, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport, Dandridge, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Caney Branch, and Bybee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene
